title: Always-On Culture and Digital Leash
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Always-On Culture and Digital Leash.

hook.text: Your phone buzzes at 10 PM. It's your boss. You answer because not answering feels like a career risk.

buildup.text: Smartphones created the 'digital leash' â€” you're physically free but psychologically tethered to work 24/7.

discovery.text: The mere expectation of after-hours email increases anxiety and reduces recovery, even if no email arrives.

twist.text: France's 'right to disconnect' law bans after-hours work emails. Productivity didn't drop â€” it rose.

climax.text: Set explicit boundaries: notification schedules, auto-replies after hours, and team norms for response times.
